div.span: The topic for ##ink-lang is: phillips electronic shavers
Topic for ##ink-lang set by freefouran!~felix@94.0.77.210 at 12:01:54 on 01/18/15
you new to IRC, don't think I've seen you here before
yeah this is my first time here!
and I need to sleep so I'll be going soon-ish
so loads of people on different times
juddus created repository juddus/pastebin 4 minutes ago
juddus created repository juddus/pastebin 17 minutes ago
juddus created repository juddus/pastebin 36 minutes ago
juddus created repository juddus/pastebin 43 minutes ago
juddus created repository juddus/pastebin an hour ago
ahh did you just decide to paste it all in a folder and commit it as one?
stites, theres a new guy here :o
then i forgot to update a few thinks
all done dippity done though now
juddus, feel free to make Ink an "official site", my love xx <3
(if I want to help out with this project, but I'm less of a C-afficianado than others, would it be possible to try to help out?)
in fact early on in the development would be the best time to contribute
stites: what are your strengths, would you say?
is there any place in particular that you would recommend looking into?
if you've done any language related stuff before then i'd recommend working on the lexer or something
if you've not programmed much at all
giving bugs a go would be good
if you're intermediate, know a bit of C not much about compilers, check out some issues
I've tried to mark the ones I feel are easier than others
stites: or if you have anything else you think would be fun/easy/interesting for you, even if it's a new idea or something just related to the project, let us know
if you in general dont want to code or whatever, but still want to help then you can think of syntax/features etc
mostly I've been doing functional frontend, distributed stuff, and ml.
damn you got an io domain
then link me to a registrar who are cheap
i got mine pretty early through namecheap
don't seem worth it to me juddus :(
I need to change my name so I can do like
ehh just want to get ink fully working
im gonna take ink to da next level m8
i really wish I wrote ink in c++ now
cause i could do a lot more
best way to get stuck in with the project, imo
is to just do it yano
just kinda figure it out as you cross the bridge, yano?
that reminds me I really need to do operator precedence parsing
i love the 1500 lines of code in parser
its not much if you compare it to like rusts 8k lines
now that I have a job I can't like stay up till 3am and just program
which could be a good thing since the amount of shit I write after midnight is crazy
when I program after like 1am I seem to forget how the parser works and try hack in stuff that's easy and obvious to do
i embarass myself in the morning
I remember I was working on ink
and then someone pointed out that I was trying to check if somethings null
if its null I free it
when it should be checking if it's not null and then freeing it
freefouran_: I was going to mention, there are a number of memory leaks currently.
ianhedoesit, yeah i'm aware of that
freefouran_ is now known as freefouran
it's not awful, but I ran it through valgrind and it was bitching at me.
ianhedoesit, yeah im not too sure where, though
i recently patched up a pretty huge memory leak from the lexer
-ChanServ- Invalid template name given, use /msg ChanServ TEMPLATE ##ink-lang for a list
thats the new one you sent me
i think this uses like flags
no i mean i did try it
I've had the urge to write a blog post about writing a simple interpreter in Go
I don't even do blog stuff
perhaps we should get a more organized kind of team thing going for Ink?
super contributors group is currently like developers
maybe. it's something to talk about.
maybe we could have like designers of the language or something
juddus: I figured hop would be fine.
is there anyway I can give you like
not on irc, I'd have to change my name
but giving us hops would be good, I think.
just say in README.md that hops in irc are so and so
can you push that I cba lol
I don't want to change my nick for all the chanels
howd you telle if it worked?
I would have a '%' before my name.
hang on let me get the help up
I realized I could try it myself lol
chemical studios, ahc, and cheery I haven't seen on here yet :(
thats probably a client specific thing
since there isn't a ~ for me
but i could be/and probably am wrong
if i can remove the tilde before my username, usually irc client specific though
so not sure if you can help
that's what it looks like for me
hm, apparently that was an issue six years ago
i think i know what to do
weechat is also nice, but I'm more familiar with irssi and like how it works out of the box more than weechat.
(it's not more functional than weechat out of the box, it's just that I prefer the default settings of irssi over weechat)
those look much better for linux
i might use them for linux
I don't know. I just ssh into my vps which is running irssi in a tmux session
I've never used any irc client on windows.
i have znc running as an irc connection manager on my linux server
gotta save that screen space on my linux vm
yeah, I've heard hexchat is reasonable.
quassel (what im using now) is pretty good
freefouran: just ssh into it with a different user?
just don't care to use it, really.
freefouran: you have a guest VM running with virtualbox or something, yeah? you should be able to just ssh into it with putty and it'll start a new shell
you're speaking another language i dont understand mlady
I have a headless ubu VM running that I can ssh into with putty as much as I want.
you don't even need to log in as a separate user
so you have a vm just for irc?
this is how I work typically
freefouran: no, I have a vps I use for irc and other things
but you can ssh into a vm that virtualbox is running
yeah, instead of hexchat just ssh into your vm with putty
dw about it hexchat is cool for now
what do I do to ssh into my boobop
your vm is running an sshd on a certain port, or it should be. I use vagrant for my vm (and you should too!), so I know what port it's running on. let me try with another vm
i've written news.ycombinator.com so many times i just type in ne and hit enter
eugh i need to sleep soon
if only we could function without sleep
freefouran left the room (quit: Quit: Leaving).
[Franklin] left the room (quit: Ping timeout: 272 seconds).
i'm kickin' it at work — pretty on and off
kicking off this sprint so that I can futz around later
working for a dna sequencing company
yeah, I've been looking at your website a little bit.
I do! I'm in the middle of the hiring process for a company
real quick, I was going to mention that it looks like there's a couple of typos on your most recent blog post
first two languages say "C" and "F," when they should be "C#" and "F#"
nope! i think i was talking about C
I was confused when I read about how C was too tightly coupled with Microsoft.
you have C listed twice. one about Microsoft and one about C
haha — i'm taking a coursera class on cuda programming now
so that list didn't help too much
what have you been up to, of late?
I've been messing around with Clojure more again recently. I think my current project is a central repository for packages for another project.
I figure I'll do it in Clojure because it's neat! haha
if you're looking to move down to the bay area, you should check us out
ugh, that was pretty up and down
nice! i haven't looked at the postings
oh, I just meant from your blog.
the company you work for is TurboSquid, though, right?
i did TurboSquid a couple of years ago
so there are something like 7-10 scientists, 7 engineers
and what do you do, primarily?
we just got acquired by Roche, so we're trying to grow out the team
so we no longer have to scrounge around for money
right now I primarily do UI
I actually worked for a company called HealthSaaS where I was the sole mobile and web app developer.
nothing as cool as what Bina does, but it was interesting working in an environment like that and having to deal with hipaa and everything
our CTO did all of that
thank god I didn't have to
well, anyhow. I'm kind of mulling through re-writing their application
trying to learn what I can from this Language PhD i sit next to
and then the CTO and I have arrangements such that I can start working on our distributed stuff when we get real UI people
hopefully nothing blows up in my face : D
that sounds better. is there already a system setup or is that something you'll be designing/implementing entirely?
so you'd just be converting everything from backbone to angular?
the other project I do is sequencing reports
so a lot of custom d3, homebrewed grids, to generate reports for rna-, dna-, mdna-, and somatic- analysis
that one is acutally pretty cool
i just had never been focused around UI before this gig
i turned down a dream job for a dream team and so it all worked out
It's weird cause I might actually stay here for a years
which is pretty unusual for me
well it's good you enjoy it. I'd love to find a job where I can just sit down and be happy and enjoy my work for awhile.
there's a lot of space from application to systems layers
to algorithms layers for the bioinformatics guys
I don't really have the option to relocate, though.
if you apply just tell me and I'll add in a note that I know you through this channel
and then just say you are interested in working remote
idk what'll happen but I know that our CTO is open to it
I'm gonna see how the last few hours of interviews I have on Wednesday go.
I don't really want to say what company just yet. not until I hear one way or the other, at least.
i understand — it can be pretty stressful
so how long have you been working on ink then?
not very long. I haven't really done much of anything so far. I got involved right when I started the interviews and everything, about two/three weeks ago.
I've just been involved with some of the discussion and I plan on doing more work on it when I'm not so busy and stressed about the job
do you do a lot of C?
i mean… you said you were doing everything — any favorites?
yeah, of course. I think C is a bit old school. I like Rust though, in the systems programming space.
unfortunately the language that got me involved with programming ~10 years ago is Pascal, which I still ues today.
currently the two languages I'm most interested in are Rust and Clojure. The two I've done the most professional work with are C# and JavaScript, probably.
yeah, haha. a community I'm involved with has their main program written in Pascal.
everyone seems to be drooling over Go, but something feels funny about it

eh, I think Go is okay. I don't like some of the restrictions on naming/file structure, but it's something I would get over easily. tons of tools (lein and others) already structure your projects in a certain way.
I think it's a fine language with few hiccups. I just don't do much in the space that it really thrives.
I'm about to shift my company into using it
and so I'm trying to get critique
minimal. I think it's neat. I don't like that it's a Microsoft project though
they have been getting a lot better about being open with everything though, as we're seeing with all .NET projects.
I think Dart is a pretty neat language. I've read a lot of documentation for it and enjoyed the changes, but haven't dont anything with it.
I think the only thing not going for it is the javascript community
yeah. really any option is owned by some big company (or it's coffeescript, which isn't much better)
